column2: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is solely focused on creating robots with human-like behaviors.
Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence.
Supervised learning requires labeled data for training.
Deep learning models require manual feature extraction
Reinforcement learning involves an agent interacting with an environment to maximize cumulative rewards.
The Turing Test evaluates a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior indistinguishable from a human.
Neural networks are inspired by the structure of the human brain.
Overfitting occurs when a model performs poorly on new
Transfer learning allows a model trained on one task to be reused on a related task.
AI systems cannot be biased since they are based purely on data.
A Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) is primarily used for text processing.
An unsupervised learning algorithm clusters data without any predefined labels.
Gradient Descent is an optimization algorithm used to minimize the error of a model.
Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) involve two networks competing against each other.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) focuses on enabling machines to understand and interact using human languages.
AI models with a higher number of parameters are always more accurate than models with fewer parameters.
Reinforcement learning does not require a reward signal to train the agent.
The "black box" problem refers to the difficulty in interpreting how certain AI models make decisions.
In supervised learning
column3: a model is trained by minimizing a loss function.

column2: AI ethics is concerned with the fairness
